data.sentence: The word ذَاتِ comes from the root ذ و and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: bore it, carried it, took it up, carried it, convey, show/manifest, conceive.
data.sentence: The word وَحَمَلْنَاهُ comes from the root ح م ل and is associated with the meanings: bore it, carried it, took it up, carried it, convey, show/manifest, conceive.

data.meanings: To change colour, become visible, gleam/shine, light up, scorching one, broad table or plate, tablet.
data.sentence: The word أَلْوَاحٍ comes from the root ل و ح and is associated with the meanings: To change colour, become visible, gleam/shine, light up, scorching one, broad table or plate, tablet.

data.meanings: To repair with nails, spear, caulk and make a ship water-tight, nail a thing, ram in.
data.sentence: The word وَدُسُرٍ comes from the root د س ر and is associated with the meanings: To repair with nails, spear, caulk and make a ship water-tight, nail a thing, ram in.
